snippet: There were 15 goals in the first four games of the World Cup, three times the number scored in the first two days of the 2010 tournament — testament, perhaps, to the quality of current forwards.
abstract: World Cup Soccer Notes; there were 15 goals in the first four games of 2014 World Cup, three times the number scored in the first two days of the 2010 tournament in South Africa; Netherlands leads the way early, with five of the 15 goals; Brazil scores three in the opener, and Chile adds a hat trick.

byline.original: By ANDREW DAS and AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE

lead_paragraph: There were 15 goals in the first four games of the World Cup, three times the number scored in the first two days of the 2010 tournament — testament, perhaps, to the quality of current forwards.

headline.main: Strong Strikers Produce a Goal Barrage
headline.print_headline: Strong Strikers Produce a Goal Barrage
